title: Ticket #6064: Negotiator crashes on Ubuntu 16
description: Ubuntu 16 has the new implementation of std::string, which uses the Short String Optimization (SSO). With this change, it is no longer valid to memcpy std:string objects (which we shouldn't have been doing in first place). However, the negotiator did keep an array of std::string's by value, which we then qsort'ed in place, causing a crash on newer gcc-compiled condors.
